column1: #Text=Altötting is one of the most important and most visited Catholic pilgrimage destination in Europe .
#Text=The city is in Upper Bavaria , close to the Austrian border .

#Text=First mentioned in the 8th century ( although the first settlements probably date back more than 3000 years ) , Altötting 's ascension as a Catholic pilgrimage destination began in the 9th century with the construction of a first monastery by King Carloman of Bavaria .
#Text=There are two airports that are suitable for a trip to Regensburg :
#Text=Munich International Airport ( MUC ) , one of the busiest airports in Europe , is located 80 km ( 50 mi ) to the west of the city with many international connections .
#Text=Salzburg International Airport ( SZG ) is situated 60 km ( 35 mi ) to the south of Altötting and has mostly domestic ( Austrian ) and a few European connections .
#Text=Altötting station is conveniently located just south of the city center , but due to its very small size lacks most amenities of a modern train station .
#Text=There are hourly connections to Munich ( 90 min ) and Landshut ( 75 min ) , and a bihourly connection to Salzburg ( 105 min ) .
#Text=With all conncetions there is a change of trains in Mühldorf am Inn .
#Text=With its rather remote location close to the Autrian border , Altötting is n't so well connected to the German highway network .
#Text=The most important ones are autobahn A 94 to Munich and federal highway B 20 to Salzburg .
#Text=Altötting , given its importance for German Catholics , is a major destination of pilgrimage .
#Text=These pilgrimages are mostly organised and go for 120-200 km and 3-5 days .
#Text=Given the city 's small size , Altötting is easily navigable on foot .
#Text=Furthermore , basically all main attractions are located around the central town square .
#Text=The basilika is the largest church in Altötting , with space for up to 8,000 people .
#Text=The services , that conclude the pilgrimage , are held in this Neo-baroque building .
#Text=( Stiftspfarrkirche St. Philipp und Jakob ) , Kapellplatz .
#Text=The first church at the location dates back to 876 , but today 's structure was completed in 1511 , as the huge number of pilgrims demanded for a bigger church .
#Text=St. Philipp and Jacob is a Gothic hall church .
#Text=( Jerusalem Panorama Kreuzigung Christi ) , Gebhard-Fugel-Weg 10 , ☏ +4986716934 , ✉ info@panorama-altoetting.de .
#Text=The largest historic panorama in Germany shows the crucifixion scene on a 12 metres high and 95 metres long oil on canvas painting , that surrounds the whole interior of the structure .
#Text=New Treasury ( Haus Papst Benedikt XVI - Neue Schatzkammer und Wallfahrtsmuesum ) , Kapellplatz 4 , ☏ +4986719242015 , ✉ haus.papst-benedikt@bistum-passau.de .
#Text=Feb-Mar M - F 9:00 - 15:00 , Apr-Oct M - Th & Sa 9:00 - 17:00 F & Su 9:00-15:00. The museum , opened in 2009 , is focused on the history of pilgrimage in Altötting .
#Text=The most valuable exhibit is a gold and enamel altar from 1404 , the so called Goldenes Rössl .
#Text=Shrine of Our Lady of Altötting ( Gnadenkapelle ) , Kapellplatz .
#Text=5:30-20:30. The shrine and the Black Madonna , that is housed in the shrine , are the destination of every pilgrimage to Altötting since 1489 .
#Text=The chapel itself dates back to the 8th century .
#Text=Three bodies and 28 hearts are buried in the structure , mostly of the royal Bavarian Wittelsbach dynasty .
#Text=Three Catholic popes visited the shrine : Pius VI in 1782 , John Paul II in 1980 , and Benedict XVI ( who was born in the nearby town of Marktl ) in 2006 .
#Text=The annual city funfair is taking place at the end of July around the central Kapellplatz square .
#Text=The Parish Fair is an annual one week long fun fair and traditional Bavarian beer festival .

#Text=the central Kapellplatz square are numerous shops for devotional objects , such as Black Madonnas in several sizes , rosaries , figures of saints and angles , icons , candles , crosses , and the like .
#Text=There are also some bookstores on religious matters .
#Text=8:00-0:00. The restaurant with sun terrace is conveniently located at the central square and serves traditional Bavarian food .
#Text=F - W 9:30-0:00. A little outside of Altötting proper , this traditional restaurant serves Bavarian food and brews its own wheat beer .
#Text=The Bavarian restaurant with sun terrace right at the city 's central square is one of the most popular places for visitors .
#Text=The hotel is one of the most traditional lodging establishments , first mentioned in 1280 .

#Text=The present-day building was designed by Italian architect Enrico Zuccalli ( who also desigend parts of Munich 's Nymphenburg Palace ) in 1688 and today is the place to stay for bishops and presidents ( and everybody else who can afford it ) , should they visit the city .
#Text=The restuarant of this well-known burger chain offers free wifi on its premises .
#Text=The capital of Lower Bavaria is 65 km ( 40 mi ) to the north .
#Text=The city 's main attractions are the quadrennial Landshut Wedding , which takes place in the well preserved medieval city center , and St. Martin 's Church , the highest church in Bavaria .
#Text=Bavaria 's state capital and its cultural and economical focal point is 95 km ( 60 mi ) to the east .
#Text=The university city of Passau at the confluence of rivers Danube , Iller and Ilz , is 80 km ( 50 mi ) to the east , close to the Austrian border .
#Text=The fourth largest city of Austria is 65 km ( 40 mi ) to the south and is not only worth a visit because of The Sound of Music but above all because of its beauty .
